title: Autoimmune Hepatitis: Epidemiology and Clinical Characteristics
short_description: Clinical overview of autoimmune hepatitis covering demographics, disease types, and epidemiological data including incidence and prevalence rates.
long_description: This document provides a comprehensive overview of autoimmune hepatitis (AIH), a rare autoimmune liver disorder with distinct demographic patterns and clinical presentations. The content covers the gender distribution showing a 4:1 female predominance, describes the two main types of AIH with Type 1 being more common in adults and Type 2 more prevalent and severe in children, and discusses variant forms that overlap with other autoimmune liver diseases. The document also presents current epidemiological data showing an incidence of 1-2 cases per 100,000 people annually and a prevalence of 24 per 100,000, while noting an unexplained increasing trend in new cases.
